abstract: Notifies you of the end of a session’s suspension.
overview:
## Discussion

NI suspends an interaction session when the user backgrounds the app. NI ends the suspension when the user foregrounds the app again. An app may resume a suspended session only after NI invokes this callback. To resume a session after a suspension ends, call [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/run(_:)], passing in your session’s configuration.

Session suspension is a local event. The framework suspends only the user’s session when the user or system event such as a phone call backgrounds the app. However, if the app stays backgrounded for too long during a suspension, NI invalidates the session with [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didInvalidateWith:)] and the peer user’s session invokes [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] with `reason` [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/timeout].

# sessionSuspensionEnded(_:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies you of the end of a session’s suspension.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func sessionSuspensionEnded(_ session: NISession)
```

## Parameters

- **session**: The session that NI suspended.

## Discussion

NI suspends an interaction session when the user backgrounds the app. NI ends the suspension when the user foregrounds the app again. An app may resume a suspended session only after NI invokes this callback. To resume a session after a suspension ends, call [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/run(_:)], passing in your session’s configuration.

Session suspension is a local event. The framework suspends only the user’s session when the user or system event such as a phone call backgrounds the app. However, if the app stays backgrounded for too long during a suspension, NI invalidates the session with [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didInvalidateWith:)] and the peer user’s session invokes [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] with `reason` [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/timeout].

## Managing interruption

- **sessionWasSuspended(_:)**: Notifies you of a suspended session.
